Reviews.Title: “great location, great staff, perfect medium-term stay”
Reviews.Author: expatwife-NBO
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband and three year old for three months in the summer of 2011. The location is perfect for travelers with kids - across the street there is a bus-stop (city direction, direct line to Luxembourg gardens, and the townhouse), a great bread shop a few buildings down, a supermarket right below, and a public park (with sand-pit, and swings) 10 min walk away. The only downside of its location is that when coming back from town, the bus-stop is a few blocks away - a small problem with a tired, uncooperative, little kid. For those who need to work, the internet was free and the connection reliable. There is a small dining room downstairs where they have coffee and tea. The apartment itself is small - one bedroom with a comfortable queen size bed, and the living room has a pull-out couch (not the most comfortable, but OK). The kitchen is tiny, but has everything that you might need - and the hotel provides all the cleaning supplies. The staff is very very friendly, and always ready to help. The nice little touch: there are umbrellas that you can borrow on rainy days, and shopping baskets on wheels for groceries.

Reviews.Title: “nice area”
Reviews.Author: lorsky
Reviews.Content: i went to paris with my brother and stayed in citadines porte de versailes for 2 nights in november. Staff were friendly and helpful. The room was ok and clean. but if you couldn't sleep in a sofabed, you better choose another hotel. The location was great with a grocery store next to the hotel and a bus stop across the street. The nearest metro station (plaisance) is only a few blocks away, about 10 minutes walk. If you love japanesse food, try the japanesse restaurant right across the street. we love the food there. Definitely will stay again next time..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Bsporty
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed two nights at this location. We had some trouble intially finding it - though no fault of hotel but us the travellers. Once we found it, we very happy of the location. Everything you need is 30seconds away - grocery store, bakery, and restaurants. We visted both the bakery and grocery store several times during our stay. The hotel is not even a 5 min walk from the Tram which can take you to the Paris Metro system - very convenient for visiting all the sites and travelling to train station (not all metro stations have escalators so pack light). The room itself was good and clean - though the layout was strange. The shower/bathtub/sink were in a room separate from the toilette. The bed were two singles - one which was the "couch" and the other pulled out from underneath it. They were comfortable enough for our short stay. We did have some issues with the heat - was way too hot but the thermostat didn't work to adjust heat only if you turned it off, so it was a delicate balance. Kitchenette had everything we needed. Our room faced out onto the street below which didn't cause too much noise except first thing in the early morning - something that sounded like a forklift moving around back and forth caused early wake ups. I would stay here again if I ever make it back - though I'd inquire about a room with an actual double sized bed if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Love the citadines hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: Emi_rocks
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris on september with my friends, ( we were 4) and had 3 nights stay at citadines. Everyone enjoy a lot this hotel. You can cook on your room which is fantastic for a low budget vacation or just to save some money, or take a break of restaurant. The citadines are just 1 minutes walk to the grocery. 10 minutes walk to the subway station. Very good service by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Paris”
Reviews.Author: KrisScotch
Reviews.Content: I immediately fall in love with this neighbourhood when I navigated through the area. I've been to Paris several times for vacations and this was my first time I came here for work. I've chosen this hotel due to the close distance to the exhibition center at Porte de Versailles and I wasn't disappointed. I upgraded my booking to the clubroom level and it was the right decision that the room was located on the very top floor with nice balcony along the living room to the bedroom giving the perfect space for refreshing air of Paris in the morning and very quiet corner at night over a glass of French wine. The bedroom is a bit small but the living room is quite spacious. Separated toilet and bathroom is pretty ideal for 3 people sharing the room. The kitchen is fully equipped with necessary utensils. Only weakness I found was that the wardrope was bit too small and not ideally enough for 4 ppl staying for a week. The convenient store next door is great, although closed on Sunday so you may like to stock up or be prepared for Sunday arrival. U can take a bus into Paris Centre (Hotel de Ville or City Hall - or u can easily get off at Pont Neuf for Notre Dame) from the bus stop right in front of the hotel, however the route on way back might be a bit tricky as it's one-way street where the hotel is located. U can easily take Metro and connect with Tram as well. Continental Breakfast is fairly average and standard for european hotel Hope you'd enjoy Paris while staying here like I did and surely I'm looking forward to my return to the city of Light agian and again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: lhc1
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights in a 1 bedroom suite. Lots of room, plenty of cupboard space. Location was great with a bus outside the door and the Metro and Tram only a few blocks away. Staff were friendly and helpful. Grocery store on street level with good selection, and pastries galore up and down the block. Would highly recommend this type of accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - one to return to!”
Reviews.Author: Nasaw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during Valentines weekend for a romantic break to celebrate our engagement anniversary. The staff were very polite, friendly and helpful everything we would expect. If you are looking to stay in the centre of a Parisien neighbourhood this is it! You can walk to the Eiffel Tower in around 1hr 30m, a step away from the antique markets, the metro is around the corner, the tram a couple of streets away. The appartment we rented was a self contained one so all the kitchen requirements one would expect, good flat screen tv, hifi - not that was much time to watch tv! There are supermarkets large and small 2-10mins away also french-moroccan owned/run supermarkets selling delicious rotisserie chickens! tubs of stuffed olives houmous etc to take back and eat in if you wish, and of course the typical coffee bars. So do stay here if you think this sounds what you are seeking! We flew from Southampton with FlyBe early on the Saturday returned the Monday and managed to fit in a good 3hrs up the Eiffel, cruised the Seine on Batobus [a must] visited the zoological gardens and did the Car Rouge [book this online prior to going to save some euros!] and a few miles of walking Paris districts, oh the tram is superquick, cheap,clean so look this one up aswell! As usual please feel free to drop us an email and we will endeavour to answer your questions. All the best Andrew 'n' Nicola ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Really liked it, the neighborhood was great. We will be back”
Reviews.Author: MariaCCP
Reviews.Content: We just came back and i will say the hotel was just what we wanted. We went we our two small children and they loved it too. The neighborhood was great, you could feel the real life in Paris, with no tourist around and we reasonable prices. Easy acces to the city centre as the bus stop is jus in front the hotel. I will recomended it, specially if travelling with children.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in paris”
Reviews.Author: b10d10
Reviews.Content: We booked the club room, it includes daily cleaning and continental breakfast. It was convenient with kids. The club rooms also has a small balcony which was very helpful. There is a great air condition (yes it was hot some of the days late April). There is a supermarket just below the hotel and other foods very near, both restaurants, fast food and traditional french breads. There is a wired free internet connection in the leaving room, which was very helpful. However, since I usually plan the day early in morning, we switch our room with the kids so I won't interrupt them. The kitchen has everything you need, including a dish washer. Although it is located not at the center of Paris, the neighborhood is nice and it is about 8 minutes walk to the nearest metro station (#13) which was good enough for us (couple+9+5) and can take you anywhere in Paris. A taxi ride from CDG airport was 45 EUR and the way back 65 EUR (during the rush hour).

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: lavender25_22
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed Citadines Porte de Versailles for 3 weeks in during my husband's official visit to Paris. The rooms were comparatively smaller. The house keeping staff werent very friendly and spoke only French. The room had all the other amenties of an apartment hotel like a fully equipped kitchen, toileteries, iron box etc. The metro station La plaiscance is almost 10 minutes away by walking..some may find it a little tiring after a long day's outing to get back to the hotel. There are a whole lot of restaurants and supermarkets in close proximity of the hotel which were very helpful for us. We also visited the flea market at the porte de Vanves which was a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and clean”
Reviews.Author: godllubGrafing
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights in the Citadines Porte de Versailles. The location is close to the Parc d'Exposition, just four stops with the tramway. The surrounding area is relatively quiet, there are coffee bars and some nice restaurants around, typical for Paris. As it is an aparthotel, there is not much service included. The rooms are clean and offer good comfort. Il liked the feeling to have a small apartment and to live like a Parisian.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a great neighbourhod”
Reviews.Author: CBeatty59
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my spouse and two friends, sharing a suite, for 12 days. Very good experience. Great little neighbourhood with everything you could possibly need, including a grocery store, just steps away. Great bus service on same street and not too far from Metro. (I recommend the bus...less crowded and a great way to see more of the city.) Room was clean and efficient. As elsewhere in Paris, space is limited, but it suited our needs. Had a few "discussions" with staff about what constituted "extra" cleaning, for which we paid 8 euros a day. Some days it was a full cleaning, other days they merely changed the towels. Odd! Front desk staff was generally helpful and friendly. Laundry in-house (a bit pricey but available 24/7) or in launderette a couple of blocks down the street. Wifi available in lobby and very reliable. Regular plug-in hi-speed internet in rooms. A desktop and printer is also available free of charge in the lobby. Liked the balcony and patio doors in both rooms of our suite. Pullout sofa bed in main room was surprisingly comfortable. Bedroom had very large regular bed (twins pushed together). Would definitely recommend. Good value and kitchenette helps you save as well. Many wonderful take-away caterers and bakeries within a stone's throw. As quiet as can reasonably be expected in a Paris neighbourhood...mostly residential with shops on main street. Had no trouble sleeping. Underground Parking available but pricey - get the weekly rate - and very tight. If you have a rental car, make it a very small one.

Reviews.Title: “Best family choice in Paris”
Reviews.Author: fadiabdelnour
Reviews.Content: The rooms were perfect ,beds comfortable,very nice view.There is a washing machine,microwave in the kitchen.Sterio,TV in the living room besides an ironer with an iron table.IT IS PERFECT.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: zjdoum
Reviews.Content: citadines didot alisia is avery good hotel apartment with 2 rooms and kitchen . near the metro station 5min walk and you can get your food from many restaurant aroud or from the frampris down the hotel in a good pris. relly it'sa verry good hotel

Reviews.Title: “quiet, clean and well positioned for metro”
Reviews.Author: mattandjess100
Reviews.Content: My partner and I decided on this particular hotel as part of an easyjet holiday package. It was our first trip to Paris and without any knowledge of the Paris area we made our decision on reviews similiar to this. To begin with, a really good tip for those who are travelling to Paris for the first time(as we were). On arrival at the CDG airport and after collecting bags, if you follow the signs indicating the metro/train station you will come across an information desk. Here you can buy a metro pass, which in our case because we were there for 4 days we purchased a 5 day pass. For the 5 day pass we payed approx. 50 euro each which was fantastic value considering a single ticket would have cost approx 8-9 euro(and we would have used the metro 10+ times during our stay). The pass also gave us access to the outer zones of the city including a trip to disneyland and surrounding areas. At the information desk you can also ask about the accommodation you have organised and the staff will quite happily print off a map and point you in the right direction. From there its a short walk to the airport metro station where you place your ticket in the machine positioned next to the gates which let you through the the main station platform. The trip on the metro with one change of trains along the way took around an hour with us getting off at the Alesia station. From the Alesia station it is about a 10-15min walk to the hotel and is very easy to find. Along the way there is a great selection of bakerys and patisseries and right next to the hotel itself is a small supermarket with all the basics. On entering the hotel we were met at reception by a very friendly member of staff who quickly confirmed our booking and gave us all the relevant information we needed. Our room was on the first floor overlooking the street below. We had absolutely no problem with being on the road frontage as the neighborhood was very quiet and we had no noise issues throughout our stay. The room was a spacious self contained apartment style setup with a well equipped kitchenette. It also had separate bathroom and toilet. It had a double sofabed in the lounge area which was easy to interchange between sofa and bed and was also very comfortable in both situations. During our 3 night stay we did not get back to the hotel before midnight any of the nights. At no stage did we ever feel unsafe walking from the train station to the hotel in the early hours of the morning and were surprised at how quiet the area was at night. Overall we had a great stay at the citadines didot alesia with it offering all the basics we required and its relative close proximity to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice if you are willing to use Metro”
Reviews.Author: drlaz
Reviews.Content: The Citadines chain are charmless, purpose-built hotel apartments, but they afford privacy and convenience for a family with children. The bedroom and living room with large sofabed had separate entrances from the hallway. The kitchenette is also useful. The air conditioning seemed like a waste when we arrived in cool rain, but when the mercury was in the 90s (that is, almost 35C), it meant a good night's sleep. The neighborhood is away from the tourist sites, but the Metro is a pleasant 7-minute walk (Plaisance) and trains run every 3 or 4 minutes until early morning. The T-3 tram is a two-minute walk, but transfers from tram to metro on the same ticket are not allowed. (If you have a pass, this is not a problem.) There is a bakery across the street with fine breakfast pastries. Many of the restaurants on the street were closed for August vacation, including the small supermarket that usually occupies the ground floor of the hotel, but we did manage to get a cheese plate at the bar up the street at 11:45pm. I know Citadines sometimes market themselves to business travelers, but the internet connection is very slow and the computer in the hotel lobby is an antique.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely apartment hotel”
Reviews.Author: kkim4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this apartment hotel for a week in Oct, 2008 with my family. This is my first time going to Paris, so I was very excited. This apartment hotel is not in the centre of Paris, it's in a residental area a bit far from all the actions are. It's takes 5-10 minutes to walk to the closest subway station. So the location is not perfect. But I do not mind the location, even though it's a bit far from subway stations, one can experience the life of Parisians when residing here. The staff are absolutely fantastic. They are helpful and approachable. The room itself is tidy, well kept and spacy too. My overall experience of this apartment hotel is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a good price!”
Reviews.Author: travelobee
Reviews.Content: I've spent 3 days at this hotel in December 2009. The room was great for the price. It was a studio with two beds and fully equipped kitchen: microwave, dishwasher, fridge, stove, toaster, coffee maker, ustensils, cups & dishes! Nice comfy beds although a bit tricky to open. Once the beds were opened there wasn't much space left in the room but who wants to stay in the room when in Paris? The location was good too, especially once we figured out how to get to Plaisance metro station instead of Alesia or Porte de Vanves. It took about 30 mins by metro to reach the Eiffel tower. The area is very quiet, we had no trouble walking around even at night. There are supermarkets nearby: a Franprix right below the hotel but it's open only between 9AM - 8.30PM and closed on Sundays. There are also other grocery stores around: smaller, more expensive but open late at night. The staff speaks English and are very friendly. The breakfast is "all you can eat" but it's typically french. Meaning, don't expect to see eggs and ham, sausage, bacon or any other meat product. You will find cereals, milk, tartes, butter, marmelade, orange juice, coffee, etc. All in all it's well worth the money and I would go back there again, even for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but simple”
Reviews.Author: ontheotherside
Reviews.Content: The Citadines extended stay hotel in rue Didot is very convenient when you are in Paris for a few weeks and want a kitchen to avoid having to go to restaurants all the time. The staff is great and really helpful to make your stay enjoyable. All of this said, this is really a middle-class building. So if you are used to charming bedrooms, this is not the place for you as you will find the environment a bit dull. However for this price level, it can be a good choice. Finally, note that the rooms have different sizes, some facing the street and others facing a private courtyard, so I suggest you contact the front desk ahead of time if you have a preference.

Reviews.Title: “Experience life in Paris with the Parisians!”
Reviews.Author: TwoUrbanistas
Reviews.Content: In mid June, my husband and I stayed at the Citadines Paris Didot Alesia for the 5th time since 2004. It is our favorite vacation spot in Europe. The hotel is clean, comfortable, and friendly. The staff speak multiple languages and are fluent in English. Our one-bedroom apartment was small--as are many modest accommodations in Europe--but we had a lovely balcony overlooking the street. Rue Didot is full of old-fashioned family-owned shops, including several bakeries, butchers, and restaurants. There are hardly any tourists in the neighborhood, so you will get to see how real Parisians live. The 58 bus stops across the street and takes you down to all the tourist attractions, such as Notre Dame. You can also take this bus to Gare Montparnesse, where you can catch the trains to Chartres Cathedral and Versailles. Two Metro stops are also nearby--Plaisance is a 5-minute walk, Alesia is a 12-minute walk. We love rue Didot and Citadines Paris Didot Alesia. If you are a lazy suburbanite who drives your SUV everywhere and hates to walk, stay away from this place, please. This is a great spot for folks who love city living, European style!

HotelInfo.Name: Citadines Porte de Versailles Paris
HotelInfo.Address: 94 rue Didot, 75014 Paris, France
